channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Study finds a popular sugar substitute might be bad for your heart
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. In the meantime, one of the study‚Äôs authors, Dr. Stanley Hazen, is telling his patients to skip the sweetener and opt for a couple of drops of honey or a pinch of sugar instead. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeA recent study published in Nature Medicine found that the sugar alternative erythritol is associated with an increased risk of heart issues and strokes. ‚ÄîSK It‚Äôs also unclear how worried folks without medical conditions should be, as the study mostly followed a population already prone to heart disease (due to conditions like diabetes or high blood pressure). While erythritol is linked to health issues, it does not necessarily cause them. Erythritol was also tied to an increased risk of blood clots in mice and human blood samples. Scientists explored the link between levels of different chemicals in the blood and the risk of heart disease. What did the study find?
item.author: Sam Klebanov

item.title: Slack is introducing AI assistant that can write messages for you
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: The DOJ is aiming to split up JetBlue‚Äôs Spirit takeover
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. And, according to the DOJ, Spirit getting scooped up would eliminate about half of all ultra-low-cost seats in the industry, sending ticket prices (which are already skyrocketing) up even further. Zoom out: The last big merger in the airline industry happened in 2016 when Alaska Airlines acquired Virgin America. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe Biden administration is continuing its full-court press against airline consolidation. According to airlines. ‚ÄîMK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! According to internal company documents that the DOJ cites in its complaint, when Spirit starts flying a given route, average fares fall by 17%. JetBlue has claimed that by increasing its size with the purchase of Spirit, it could better compete with the ‚Äúbig four‚Äù airlines: United, Delta, American, and Southwest. org, there have been 21 completed US airline mergers since 2001.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: Municipalities across the US are naming their snowplows
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. All 240 plows operated by Transport Scotland now have names. Madison isn‚Äôt the only city with named plows. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeA storm drain? ‚ÄîMK Where‚Äôd this come from? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! The idea of naming municipal equipment seems to have been spawned in Scotland, where a 2006 primary school contest to name gritters (snowplows) caught on in a big way. But a storm drain officially named Stormy Drainels?
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: This company discovered a (disc) diamond in the rough
item.description: They generally look to companies like Dymicron for these solutions so they can partner or acquire to distribute them. Learn more about investing in their disc replacements. The Triadyme¬Æ-C implant eliminates the primary long-term issue with traditional disc replacements: wear debris. So, how many carats are in each disc replacement? Using a tri-lobe design, this artificial disc is molded from human-made diamond that never wears out (üíé really are forever). The Triadyme¬Æ-C disc replacement shows powerful potential: It‚Äôs already available outside the US and on its way to FDA approval stateside. No other disc on the market can provide this combination of zero wear debris and the exceptional biomechanics that our innovative tri-lobe design offers. And that‚Äôs a diamond worth noticing. But beyond that, additional degeneration can develop if the motion of an artificial disc doesn‚Äôt closely align with a patient‚Äôs natural movement. Now we can generate a whole new fan base of people and bring on investors who can help us solve the problem of degenerative disc disease. How do Dymicron‚Äôs discs improve the patient experience? You can help Dymicron bring this solution to those in need. That‚Äôs the exciting part of what the SEC and Congress have done with the Jumpstart Our Business Startups Act. It created equity crowdfunding opportunities so we can raise capital through interested retail investors.
item.author: Morning Brew

item.title: E-bike batteries are exploding, setting buildings on fire
item.description: . The number of blazes has been rising in tandem with the number of e-bikes sold: The US imported over 1 million last year, a gear shift up from 880,000 in 2021 and 450,000 in 2020, according to the Light Electric Vehicle Association. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Lithium-ion batteries were the fourth leading cause of fire deaths in NYC last year, per the FDNY. It‚Äôs the latest in a string of fires started by the lithium-ion batteries in electric bikes and scooters. It‚Äôs about the batteries. There‚Äôs a solution in the worksThe New York City Council approved several bills last week that 1) add new safety and certification standards for micromobility vehicles 2) launch educational campaigns on safe usage and 3) restrict the use and sale of secondhand batteries. They‚Äôve caused at least 30 fires, 40 injuries, and two deaths in NYC this year as of Feb. 27, according to the New York Fire Department. ‚ÄîJW The fires they cause are nightmarish: Lithium-ion battery fires can engulf a room in about 15 seconds, per the UL Fire Safety Research Institute. These batteries are safe unless they‚Äôre faulty or damaged, and e-bikes and e-scooters are subject to a lot of hard use hauling commuters and delivery workers up and over NYC‚Äôs bridges. The problem is especially evident in New York City, where on Sunday an e-bike battery sparked an hourslong blaze at a Bronx grocery store that injured seven.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Municipalities across the US are naming their snowplows

Madison isn‚Äôt the only city with named plows. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeA storm drain? ‚ÄîMK Where‚Äôd this come from? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! The idea of naming municipal equipment seems to have been spawned in Scotland, where a 2006 primary school contest to name gritters (snowplows) caught on in a big way. But a storm drain officially named Stormy Drainels?
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: Air travel might be getting bumpier
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. It‚Äôs also elevating the risk of clear-air turbulence, which appears out of the blue and gives pilots little time to order passengers to buckle up. Only 146 people were seriously injured by severe turbulence between 2009 and 2021, per the Federal Aviation Administration‚Äîand most were not wearing their seatbelts. ‚ÄîSK Airplanes are designed to withstand intense shaking, while pilots are trained to safely navigate intense wind‚Ä¶even if your plane meatloaf sticks to the aircraft ceiling. Are the skies becoming more treacherous? Last week alone, turbulence was responsible for: at least seven injuries aboard a transatlantic Lufthansa red-eye, the aborted landing of a North Carolina-bound Southwest flight, and a passenger death on a business jet traveling between New Hampshire and Virginia. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Extreme turbulence is still very rare and not usually dangerous. But in general, you should still be more concerned about the prospect of a canceled flight than a shaky one.
item.author: Sam Klebanov

Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Lithium-ion batteries were the fourth leading cause of fire deaths in NYC last year, per the FDNY. These batteries are safe unless they‚Äôre faulty or damaged, and e-bikes and e-scooters are subject to a lot of hard use hauling commuters and delivery workers up and over NYC‚Äôs bridges. item.title: Walgreens won‚Äôt sell popular abortion pill in some states after legal threat
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Walgreens, the second-largest pharmacy chain in the US, said it would work to become one of those pharmacies but quickly saw pushback from anti-abortion lawmakers. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeWalgreens said Thursday that it will not distribute abortion pills in 20 states, including several where abortion is legal. ‚ÄîMM Medication abortions account for more than half of all legal abortions in the US, and mifepristone is part of a popular two-drug protocol. So now, the company says it won‚Äôt sell the pills in those states, either in its stores or by mail, even though the FDA also said mifepristone could be mailed to states with abortion bans.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Amazon hits pause on 2nd headquarters
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. And it‚Äôs just one of the many ominous signs for the commercial real estate market since people no longer go into the office every workday. The company has put an indefinite hold on breaking ground for the swanky office park known as PenPlace, which would encompass three 22-story towers and a sleek helix-shaped building. ‚ÄîSK The company is also reducing its physical footprint elsewhere. And headcount is unlikely to skyrocket any time soon: Amazon began laying off 18,000 employees in January (the steepest job cuts in its history). But for now, it‚Äôs not short on office space: Its employees still spend a lot of time working from home, even after a recent companywide mandate required them to return to the office three days a week. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeAmazon‚Äôs HQ2 is starting to look more like HQ1.5. Other Big Tech companies like Meta and Twitter have also slimmed down their real estate footprint to save money. Earlier this year, it vacated an office tower in its hometown, Seattle.
item.author: Sam Klebanov

item.title: More companies are selling a ‚Äòfirst-class‚Äô experience
item.description: . A Le Creuset instead of a regular ol‚Äô Dutch oven? Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. Big picture: The urge to focus on premium products could result in fewer options for lower-income Americans, who spend a greater share of their income on essentials like housing and food, the NYT notes.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: ChatGPT not a hit on college campuses...yet
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. And while overall ChatGPT adoption is low on college campuses, it has gained power users. 56% of respondents who haven‚Äôt used ChatGPT said the primary reason why is that they‚Äôve not had a use for it. 25% of the students who‚Äôve used ChatGPT have it bookmarked on their web browser. And the students who said they do fire up ChatGPT‚Ä¶don‚Äôt use it all that much, as 55% of respondents who said they‚Äôve used ChatGPT do so ‚Äúalmost never.‚Äù Uses for ChatGPTAmong the students who do use ChatGPT‚Ä¶what are they using it for? For giggles: 71% of students who‚Äôve used ChatGPT said they use it in part for entertainment or just for fun. 17% of students who‚Äôve heard of ChatGPT said they have direct knowledge of friends using ChatGPT to cheat. Of course, ChatGPT was released just a few months ago‚Äîso in a sense it is also quite remarkable that 60% of college students have heard of it. In our poll, the majority said no, but it‚Äôs still notable that 20% of students who‚Äôve heard of ChatGPT said the chatbot has influenced their career thinking. As Google: 32% of students who‚Äôve used ChatGPT said they use it in part for quick answers to simple questions, and 31% to understand complex topics. So, why aren‚Äôt college students using ChatGPT? For‚Ä¶cheating? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Gov‚Äôt cash for chipmakers comes with contentious strings attached
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The Biden administration appears to be using the CHIPS and Science Act to kill an entire flock of birds with one stone. One policy think tank called the childcare requirement ‚Äúa pragmatic move‚Äù since it‚Äôll help companies recruit women amid a shortage of affordable childcare. He warns that the Biden administration infusing the program with social goals will raise costs for chip manufacturers. A spokesperson for the Commerce Department told Morning Brew that workforce considerations are just one part of the holistic process for doling out funding, which gives ‚Äúmost weight‚Äù in an application to ‚Äúnational and economic security.‚Äù The law aims to spur semiconductor manufacturing in the US, but its $39 billion subsidy program, which the Commerce Department presented this week, puts strict conditions on companies looking to access the funds. The Commerce Department will take companies‚Äô willingness to refrain from stock buybacks into account, and some recipients of federal cash will have to share windfall profits with the government. The WSJ‚Äôs Chief Economics Commentator Greg Ip called the requirements ‚Äúmission creep‚Äù and argued that they might undercut the competitiveness of the US chips subsidies, noting that Canada, the EU, and Japan are also offering cash to lure in chipmakers. ‚ÄîSK Chips vs. The Commerce Department says the rules will help create the ‚Äúlarge, skilled, and diverse workforce‚Äù that companies need to churn out chips. childcare: what critics are sayingCritics have dubbed the Biden Administration‚Äôs implementation of the CHIPS Act ‚Äúindustrial social policy,‚Äù contending that it‚Äôs a Trojan horse for progressive measures unrelated to the main purpose of the program: making the US into a major chip producer.
item.author: Sam Klebanov

item.title: Brew Classifieds: Week of February 27
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. On eBay, a single box is selling for as much as $79.99. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. ‚ÄîMM SOMETHING BLUE: The US marriage rate has fallen nearly 60% in the last 50 years as people have delayed the storied tradition of their uncle getting blackout drunk near their friends, or skipped it altogether.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Eli Lilly finally gives in to insulin price-cut pressure
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeSome diabetic Americans will soon be able to spend less than their monthly internet bill to pick up life-saving medicine. It also said it would cap insulin costs at $35/month when people pay out-of-pocket for the drug. Insulin-makers like Eli Lilly have received growing social and political pressure over the last few years to make insulin more affordable. Drugmaker Eli Lilly said yesterday it would slash the list prices for its two most prescribed insulin products, Humalog and Humulin, by 70%. If you‚Äôre feeling a little d√©j√† vu‚Ä¶you‚Äôre probably thinking of the viral tweet from November written by Sean Morrow, who paid $8 for a blue checkmark in order to impersonate Eli Lilly and announce that ‚Äúinsulin is free now.‚Äù ‚ÄîMM css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Lilly is getting ahead of DC dramaThe Inflation Reduction Act included a $35 monthly insulin price cap for seniors on Medicare, and in his State of the Union address last month, President Biden called for expanding that cap to everyone.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Whiskey fungus is out of control around Jack Daniel‚Äôs barrelhouses in Tennessee
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. An out-of-control, soot-like whiskey fungus is spreading in Tennessee and causing a rift between residents and famed whiskey-maker Jack Daniel‚Äôs. ‚ÄîMK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Residents are asking for Jack Daniel‚Äôs to fund an environmental study to see if the vapors or fungus harm humans, and install an air filtration system to slow their spread.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: Californians recover from almost-record snowfall as another storm heads their way
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Big picture: California‚Äôs wet and wild winter has freed up half of the state from drought, according to data from the US Drought Monitor. Mountain High in Southern California averages 67 inches of snowfall every season.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Chinese apps face restrictions, but US consumers keep downloading
item.description: . Experts can‚Äôt agree on whether Chinese apps are a threatAn exec at the think tank founded by former Google CEO Eric Schmidt wrote last month that all of these uber-popular Chinese apps, including the messenger WeChat and game apps from Tencent, ‚Äúcould pose similar challenges [to TikTok], particularly with respect to data harvesting, data exploitation, and‚Äîpossibly‚Äîcovert influence.‚Äù Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The top three free apps on Apple‚Äôs App Store yesterday were Temu, CapCut, and TikTok, while Google Play‚Äôs were Temu, TikTok, and Street Fighter: Duel‚Äîwith Chinese fast-fashion company Shein chilling at No. 4. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeIt‚Äôs no secret that the government considers TikTok a national security threat. ‚ÄîJW
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: BriAnna Garza can teach you how to shoot a basketball
item.description: . Kyrie Irving is excellent at his free throws because he‚Äôs able to get into a kind of spiritual place. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. What‚Äôs the one thing amateur basketball players should work on in the gym to improve their shot? Last year I did a six-month study of watching every single catch-and-shoot in the NBA with 33,000 data points. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. The free throw is so strange because there‚Äôs no other shot in basketball like it. How do you coach free throws and how much is mental over technique? So no one shot is going to look exactly the same. If you‚Äôre gonna work on one thing, get that down. And there‚Äôs a reason Garza thinks deeply about basketball shots‚Äîshe makes a living from doing it.
item.author: Neal Freyman

Musk, who recently reclaimed the title of world‚Äôs richest person thanks to a¬†$310 billion surge in Tesla stock, called it his ‚ÄúMaster Plan 3‚Äù (with a straight face) and tried to sell investors on Tesla‚Äôs super-long-term goals.

item.title: Eli Lilly finally gives in to insulin price-cut pressure
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeSome diabetic Americans will soon be able to spend less than their monthly internet bill to pick up life-saving medicine. It also said it would cap insulin costs at $35/month when people pay out-of-pocket for the drug. Insulin-makers like Eli Lilly have received growing social and political pressure over the last few years to make insulin more affordable. Drugmaker Eli Lilly said yesterday it would slash the list prices for its two most prescribed insulin products, Humalog and Humulin, by 70%. If you‚Äôre feeling a little d√©j√† vu‚Ä¶you‚Äôre probably thinking of the viral tweet from November written by Sean Morrow, who paid $8 for a blue checkmark in order to impersonate Eli Lilly and announce that ‚Äúinsulin is free now.‚Äù ‚ÄîMM css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Lilly is getting ahead of DC dramaThe Inflation Reduction Act included a $35 monthly insulin price cap for seniors on Medicare, and in his State of the Union address last month, President Biden called for expanding that cap to everyone.
item.author: Matty Merritt

This bill also includes billions of dollars for Afghan refugee resettlement and aid for communities hit by recent hurricanes.

item.title: Blue Origin accused of running a sexist ship
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}Subscribe21 current and former employees of Jeff Bezos‚Äôs space company, Blue Origin, published an open letter on Thursday describing it as a ‚Äútoxic‚Äù workplace ‚Äúrife with sexism.‚Äù Spearheaded by Blue Origin‚Äôs former head of employee communications, Alexandra Abrams, the letter alleges that the company is dismissive of safety concerns, creates a sexist environment for female employees, and stifles professional dissent. ‚ÄîMK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! The behavior was so well known, the letter claims, that some women at the company would warn new female hires to stay away from the executive (who, according to the letter, had a close personal relationship with Jeff Bezos). They also wrote that another former male executive would inquire about female employees‚Äô dating lives, referring to them as ‚Äúbaby doll‚Äù or ‚Äúbaby girl.‚Äù
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: Macy‚Äôs sues over potential Amazon billboard
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Macy‚Äôs said an ad from a company like Amazon would damage the ‚Äúcustomer goodwill, image, reputation, and brand,‚Äù according to the filing. The chain crushed Q2 earnings and reported that digital customers accounted for 41% of its 5 million new shoppers last quarter. And like anyone with property that close to a Shake Shack, the department store chain is holding onto it for dear life, even suing the ad agency that owns the billboard. Neither Amazon nor Kaufman have responded to the lawsuit or the claims. ‚ÄîMM css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeIt appears that Amazon is after another piece of Macy‚Äôs business: its iconic NYC billboard.

Another closely watched mandate was implemented by New York‚Äôs health system, which required all workers to have at least one vaccine dose by Monday. Around 90% of NBA players are vaccinated, much higher than the US‚Äô overall vaccination rate, but the league is likely frustrated that one of its most influential stars is, at least for now, bucking the trend.
